Package opennlp.ccg.disjunctivizer

Package for the disjunctivizer, which creates a disjunctive LF XML structure based on an LFGraphDifference.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
AlignedEdgeFilter A filter for edges that tests whether they are aligned based on a specified set of alignment indices.
Disjunctivizer Creates a disjunctive logical form from a difference between two graphs.
EdgeMatchFilter A filter for LF edges based on a set of match type criteria.
FilteredLFEdgeSet A filtered set of LF edges.
LabelMatchFilter A filter for edges based on a comparison of their labels.
LFGraphDifference Represents the difference between two LFGraphs that characterizes their difference as a set of edits: either LFGraphDifference.inserts(), LFGraphDifference.deletes(), or LFGraphDifference.substitutions().
MatchTypeFilter Abstract class for filters that allow LFEdges based on criteria indicated by the set of match types they use.
VertexMatchFilter A filter that matches vertices based on a basis vertex and a set of match type criteria.
 

Enum Summary
MatchType A set of enum constants for identifying the matching criteria used by a MatchTypeFilter.
 

Package opennlp.ccg.disjunctivizer Description

Package for the disjunctivizer, which creates a disjunctive LF XML structure based on an LFGraphDifference. An LF graph difference is a characterization of the difference between two graphs and an Alignment between them in terms of the edits needed to make one into the other: inserts, deletes, and substitutions.

The FilteredLFEdgeSet class extends FilteredSet to also provide views of its edges by source, target, or label. The various filters in this package provide a lot of flexibility in terms of how to filter edges: whether their source, target, or label matches a given edge's (or just their predicates), whether their source or target is aligned, etc. These filters, and the FilteredLFEdgeSet class, are used internally by the Disjunctivizer for generating disjunctive LFs.
